task_summary: A robot arm is tasked with pouring the contents from its held container into a mug placed on a table. The tree orchestrates mug localization, approach, pouring, and safety retreat.

task_long_description.overview: In this episode, a robotic arm performs the task of pouring liquid into a mug situated on a tabletop workspace. The mug is the target receptacle for the pour, and the robot is equipped with a container (source) mounted in its gripper. Visual detection ensures mug localization, while approach is executed vertically for safety. Pouring is performed via controlled tilt, and the sequence concludes with a retreat, presumably to reduce risk of spillage or collision.
preconditions: Mug is placed upright and accessible on table
Container/gripper is holding the pour source
Robot’s workspace is free of major obstructions
Robot arm is unpaused and ready to execute
stepwise_plan: Ensure mug is visible, retry detection up to 3 times
Pour from container into mug at 90° tilt at normal rate
success_criteria: Liquid transferred into mug with minimal spillage
Mug is not knocked over or displaced
Robot did not abort due to detection/approach failure
failure_and_recovery: Mug not detected – retry scan up to 3 times
Pour was obstructed – abort and retreat
Minor spillage – do not retry pouring
task_long_description.termination: Sequence terminates after retreat, whether pour succeeded or failed.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the mug is visible in the workspace.
Scans area in arc pattern up to 3 times to locate mug.
Detects and localizes the mug precisely.
Moves robot arm to a position 10cm above the mug.
Pours contents from held container into mug at maximum tilt.
Moves arm 10cm away from mug after pouring.

recovery_strategy: Retry mug scan up to 3 times
Abort and retreat if pour or detection fails
assumptions: Instruction does not specify source; inferred as 'container' from gripper in frames.
Amount poured not specified; set to null.
Frames do not show explicit grasp or object manipulation, start is already pre-grasped.
No evidence of adjust-for-tolerance or force management in visual sequence.
